title: proposal: shortcut for map[string]interface{}
body:
`map[string]interface{}` appears to be a commonly used way for creating a "freestyle object" (much like anonymous objects in C# or dictionaries in python). It is even used in [your own examples][example]. I agree that using this too often can make code difficult to work with, but there are times when it is necessary.

What would be the implications for adding a shortcut `{}` like that in [python][pythondict]? I'm not proposing that the actual map itself behave any different or have any special functions or features outside of the standard map. I would only imagine that `{"Name": "Brett"}` be a shortcut for `map[string]interface{}{"Name": "Brett"}`.


[example]: https://github.com/golang/go/blob/0104a31b8fbcbe52728a08867b26415d282c35d2/doc/progs/json3.go#L26

[pythondict]: https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/datastructures.html#dictionaries
